Reviews.Title: “Our stay at IQs made our trip memorable!”
Reviews.Author: AprilKeenan
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Venice and we were very pleased that we chose IQs Charming House. The location is perfect. Being on a smaller canal and waking up to the music of the Gondolas...priceless! The room was spacious and modern, the breakfast -prepared in the room for us- was a real treat!!! As for the staff, Anna and Soroz, they could not have been better! Thank you very much for making us feel at home. We will come back to see you very soon!

Reviews.Title: “OUR STAY IN YOUR HOTEL WAS A GREAT EXPERIENCE!!”
Reviews.Author: IsraelRachel
Reviews.Content: We really spend a great time in your hotel. We were upgraded to suite Q4 and they treated us as Royalty! Anna was the best possible host, all her tips were Great!!! Maya Negri and Or Zaid, Israel

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: priya s
Reviews.Content: The service at iQs was spectacular! John was very helpful and catered to all our needs with a smile! Best service received out of all the hotels we stayed at in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Jen R
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay in the Charming House iQs which is a beautiful design hotel ! The staff is charming. Venice is a lovelly place and it's perfect for 3 or 4 days. Perfect for a romantic getaway ! Thank you very much Chiara, we'll come back to see you ! We'll maybe try the other place of the hotel next time...

Reviews.Title: “Truly charming”
Reviews.Author: Naomio28
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Charming House IQS from 4 - 7 November 2011. I coud not recommend this hotel highly enough - it is really more like staying in a very high end hotel. Anna and Nadia were extremely helpful and really went the extra mile. The rooms are beautifully furnished in a modern "boutique hotel" style. The hotel is extremely conveniently located in the centre of Venice and has its own jetty. Looking out the window to passing gondolas just below really was a unique experience. Expensive but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “out of category”
Reviews.Author: Peter L
Reviews.Content: I got a five star feeling, because I got a warm welcoming and stayed in the middle of this fantastic city. To get the breakfast ready in your room, was always a good start in the day, even if you get woked up from ships in the channel dircetly under your window. It was a pleasant stay with a feeling of getting back home and not to get back in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Paul Q
Reviews.Content: Service is really good, staff is very helpful, hotel is very different.

Reviews.Title: “The right regrets- Charming House IQs- Venice”
Reviews.Author: simon088
Reviews.Content: Arthur Miller said that, " Maybe all one can do is to hope to end up with the right regrets" . My family have just spent 4 days in the city staying at Charming House IQs, a small hotel with 4 rooms/suites. The stay was excellent. Once we found the hotel, discreetly non-signposted and over it's own Venetian bridge, one is met by reception staff ( Nadia and Anna) of great charm and helpfulness. Good restaurants booked, advice provided on places to see, routes to get there , but left to one's own devices if not required. The water taxi delivered us to the hotel's own private jetty- the coolest entry into a city ever! The location is central but hidden away. In short one couldn't wish for better, and whilst there is no room service, the essential Nespresso coffee maker helps with the espresso boosts on needs when one is flagging. The hotel ensured that the visit to Venice did not register as one of life's regrets.

Reviews.Title: “fanstastic property!”
Reviews.Author: sygg
Reviews.Content: Room was vey beautiful with a modern deisgn and cosy. We bought some food from nearby supermarket and cook dinner on one of the night. Staff provided excellent service during our stay and the breakfast in the room was really enjoyable. Very close to san marco and rialto ~ 10mins walk. i do feel the bed is bit stiff for my comfort. strangly my ipad did not manage to link up to the wifi.p but we have an iphone which was able to access internet via wif Definitely will recommend to friends and my preferred stay if we ever visit venice again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Charmed by Charming House”
Reviews.Author: NanajanPerth
Reviews.Content: After staying in Medieval hotels and villas for the week before, we were ready for some luxury and Charming House iQ's did not disappoint. Our room was ultra modern and comfortable with huge bed which my husband (6ft4in) was especially grateful for! Renaissance man was kinda short! And the team at the hotel could not do enough for us, recommending places to eat, arranging laundry service and even helping me track down my sunnies I lost at Marco Polo airport (thankyou Anna)..way beyond the call of duty. Also very central without being in the noisy part of Venice. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous place”
Reviews.Author: T N
Reviews.Content: A beautiful room and a gorgeous setting. The location was in a quiet little square but easy to find and very close to St Marks Square. Our room opened up into a stunning courtyard and the reception has its own private jetty where we were picked up by water taxi. The staff were fantastic and very helpful, we arrived late at night after a delayed flight and they helped us out with a place to eat and sorted a reservation. Our first wedding anniversary was magical and the Charming House IQs was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull place”
Reviews.Author: irajus
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in July 2011. The hotel gave an impression as if you are living in your own small apartment in Venice. We booked a transfer from the airport to the hotel, which was very convenient. We really liked the modern design of our room. The room (â€œcharmingâ€�) was equipped with all the necessary staff - bathrobe, slipper, coffe machine, tea and kettle, repellent. The room "charming'" fits for two persons only. The location was really nice and central (10 min to San Marko). Would be nice to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming House Indeed”
Reviews.Author: Megs87
Reviews.Content: Absolutely Beautiful hotel, very helpful happy staff with Perfect english. The Breakfast is amazing. Thank you for looking after us. We loved Venice <3

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place to stay- super on it staff- want to come back !”
Reviews.Author: emiliemuller
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on tablet- it did not disappoint at all

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous apartment, fabulous position and spectacular view”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary30
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few nights in late May 2011 following effortless transactions via email. Due to the fact we were travelling for 2 months between seasons and had a large amount of luggage we took a water taxi from the railway station which was well worth the 70 euros - the novelty of arriving at the boat ramp to enter the reception area was priceless. The receptionist (and I apologise for forgetting her name) was exceptional, making us instantly welcome and providing us with great recommendations for meals and trips during our stay. We took endless videos of the gondolas cruising past right outside our window - something we will never forget , especially the gondoliers who sang as well. The apartment was great, very spacious, comfortable bed, huge shower and a beautiful fresh breakfast was provided every morning. They also provide free wifi which was fabulous. It takes only a few minutes to walk to San Marco via beautiful little alleys. Walking in the opposite direction for a few minutes one evening took us to a restaurant the receptionist had recommended - L'Osteria di Santa Marina - and we thank her for the recommendation as the food was excellent, very different from some horrible experiences we had previously had in restaurants close to the San Marco area. We can highly recommend these apartments as they more than meet the requirements to make a visit to Venice such a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: DrEMYG
Reviews.Content: AmaZing staff and services! Cosy and friendly with the best in room breakfast ever. All the recommendations were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “the quintessential Venetian experience”
Reviews.Author: mon006
Reviews.Content: The Charming House iQs proved the perfect base for three unforgettable days in Venice. The apartments are perfectly located about 5 mins walk to St Marco Square looking out over a lovely, quiet little square. Canals run along two sides of the house. We loved watching the gondolas and taxi boats floating by. A major highlight of our trip was when we were picked up by taxi boat. We boarded the boat from the lobby, via an ancient access to the canal. The apartments were perfectly clean and very spacious with a bedroom and a living room (the sofa converts to another double bed.) We loved the contrast of the very tastefully furnished modern apartments in the 700-year old building. Traveling with children, having a kitchen was very helpful - and shopping in the local supermarket another authentic Italian experience. The staff was extremely helpful - (esp. Anna!). They did not rest until we had the perfect restaurant reservation to please every family member. We'll definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Our own Italian apartment in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Seesean
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about it. Great service, staff was very hospitable. Beautiful room with a great location close to Saint Mark's square. Delivered us an amazing breakfast every morning. We stayed in the IQS. Don't arrive at night, it was hard to find. I'd recommend this hotel if you're going to Venice. There was also a pull out couch. If you have kids or another couple traveling with you.

Reviews.Title: “magic, romantic trip !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Laetitia1980
Reviews.Content: Really nice city, so beautiful and romantic place. Hotel was perfect, cozy and comfortable !

Reviews.Title: “An amazing find!”
Reviews.Author: Maryanne37
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this beautiful gem of a hotel for eight nights from March 11-20, 2011. Our room was more like an small apartment and was beautifully furnished and spotless. The location is so gorgeous...on a quiet small campo with a tiny canal right out the living room window where we could see gondolas go by. Every morning, the wonderful staff delivered a lovely breakfast of our choosing and we enjoyed it at a tastefully decorated dining room table. An excellent coffee machine offered one cup choices. The two staff members were friendly, professional and so very helpful with every question we had. Our unit also had plush towels and robes for our use and the king size bed was very comfy. Unfortunately, I experienced a fairly serious health issue and the staff members were extremely helpful in translating, scanning and sending documents to various doctors and insurance providers. Their genuine concern was very much appreciated by us both. Our only 'complaint' was the size of the bathroom area. We have been fortunate enough to travel to various locations in Europe and do understand that European bathrooms are much smaller than in other locations; however, this 'area' was very tiny. There was a separate toilet 'room', a basin in the middle and a shower to the other side with its own door. Typically, we had to stand in the doorway of the bathroom area to stand in front of the basin to brush teeth, blow dry hair etc. However, we quickly adapted; such a trivial issue in comparison to such an amazing suite otherwise! We would HIGHLY recommend this hotel. It is truly worth every single penny. And with only four units, it's very quiet, VERY romantic and very private. And again, I cannot speak more highly of Anna and the young man who worked at the front desk. This was our second visit to Venice and if we are lucky enough to return, we would certainly stay here again. Enjoy every minute!

Reviews.Title: “It feels like home...”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeZikos
Reviews.Content: After an extensive research over the Internet, we came across these stylish suites in the heart of Venice, but far away anything made for tourists. Outside it holds the historical beauty of the city, but inside it is more contemporary than you can ever imagine. It felt right away that we were residents of this magnificent city. The staff was extremely helpful and proposed all the right places in order to make our stay a loving memory. Such a Charming hotel, with an IQ way above average...

Reviews.Title: “Charming is an understatement~!”
Reviews.Author: RP0101
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Felt like a local in a fabulous well designed apartment. I hate to give it a good review but the owner promised to always have a room for me. I fell in love with Venice, before I even walked outside, because of the hotel, the servie, Anna, etc. A great find and I will make everyone I know stay here. It is not to be missed along with everything else about Venice.!

Reviews.Title: “Live like a local”
Reviews.Author: BlissfulG
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a reservation at The Charming House through Orbitz.com. My husband emailed to check on our room location only to find that Orbitz had never sent the hotel our reservation and the hotel was booked! After a lot of frustrating back and forth with Orbitz, the hotel offered to move us to the IQs and give us an extra night if we changed our date of arrival, which we did. They were very gracious throughout the entire experience. Orbitz...not so much. Never using them again. When we did arrive at the hotel--in the water taxi the hotel organized for us for 100 euro--we were brought directly to the door of the hotel so no frustrating treks through Venice's small streets with our luggage--we had a lot since we were there for 8 days. The hotel itself is more like a converted series of small apartments with a main area. Anna, our charming host, was there to greet us and gave us the lay of the land. Free wi-fi and breakfast are included. They bring breakfast to your room every morning and you can pick and choose what you like. Our first day we had yogurt, croissants, rolls, juice, milk, and jams. We also used the in-room espresso machine quite a lot. We stopped getting breakfast a few days in because my husband prefers hitting the cafes and pastry shops. Still, a great service for those who want to laze around in the morning. The rooms were very nice...spacious and modern. There were tons of windows onto the canal and campo, although you could make it very dark by drawing the brown velvet curtains. We had a sitting area, small kitchenette, tres cool dining table in leather with four seats, and a flat screen in the living room. The bed (in the other room) was a low-profile bed with plenty of room for two. Loved the "fireplace" TV, but my favorite part was the sound of the water lapping up against our walls. So relaxing and romantic--especially when the gondola with singers went by. My only complaint was that the rooms, while very stylish, look a little worn--mainly the places where you can tell they've painted over damage. There were also a few spiderwebs around the room too, but we took care of that with a washcloth. Spiderwebs in an old city are par for the course. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at the IQs and especially our time in Venice, which is a magical city. Anna was a perfect hostess who always met our questions with a smile and a can-do attitude. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel among jewels!”
Reviews.Author: RichC1717
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Venice 3 times prior to this visit, including a stay on the Lido and a week at the Danielli. Venice is truly one of the unique places in the world to visit and most of its hotels are unique as well. The general rule for the upper end Venice hotels is pretty expensive, good service, dramatic facades and lobbies, followed by individual rooms that are small, dated and quite uninspiring. The Charming House IQ truly breaks this mold. The unmarked entrance off the canal is picture book, opening to a small lobby. There is no grand lobby or public area. Guests are given a set of keys to the iron gate fronting the piazza and the heavy wooden unmarked door which opens to a private courtyard. We had a two room suite with 2 in each room and a private entry to each room. The larger room contained a small kitchen area and a full sized living room. Sharing this space was the best of all worlds. Furnishings were urban upscale (think W hotel) as a opposed to old and stuffy. Rooms and the bathrooms are huge by Venice standards. The staff was fabulous. Extremely helpful. They set the table each morning in our living room and catered in a nice continental breakfast and brought ice for evening drinks. The lobby is not staffed all day - they are there from 8 -12 and then 5:30 -8. As there are only a small number of rooms, this is all that is needed. We were provided with directions and recommendations for cool spots based on our tastes. I feel we are now friends with the staff. Much more fun than dealing with a snooty concierge. We have a new home in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and beautifully appointed appartments in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug0z
Reviews.Content: What a find! After doing alot of research on the internet I stumbled across IQ suites and they certainly lived up to the expectation. In a quiter section of Venice in the Castello district but still only 5 minutes walk from all the main sites, the IQ suites is a perfect place to retire in the evening after a long day in the Venetian sun. Entry via a private bridge and then through medieval doors into this tranquil peace of heaven. Our room was large and modern with a beautiful bathroom that had a window looking out to the internal courtyard and the bedroom had a massive window that looked out onto the canal and bridges outside....postcard pretty. Andrea was extremely helpful and efficient as were all the staff. Breakfast is served in the room each morning. These appartments would suit anyone wanting to get away from the big hotel experience and enjoy a modern, boutique and truly romantic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Like a modern bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Techie999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably on of the nicest I've stayed in for some time. The staff was extremely helpful from before we even checked in. I got a call as we were arriving in Venice to let me know they were sending us a private water taxi to pick us up. Once we arrive at the dock it was like our own little private slice of Venice. The front desk made us dinner reservations at a couple of places which were excellent. Breakfast was delivered to our room and was a much bigger spread then we expected. The room was really modern with everything you could need from an expresso maker to free wifi, and huge (separate living room, dining space, kitchen, big bedroom, nice shower). This hotel has a very bed and breakfast homey feeling. Highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: “What can be better than this?”
Reviews.Author: Dopeyfong
Reviews.Content: My husband and I has chosen to stay in the Charming House IQs as attracted by its website and its great location (near San Marco). Upon our arrival, everything lived up to our expectations or even better when we went into our room (although we got a bit lost when trying to find the hotel in the first place but normal for all tourists in Venice). We stayed in a suite and the room is extremely big, nicely decorated and everything is perfectly placed and the staff is just super friendly. Breakfast is great (if you go, remember to ask for ham for breakfast which comes for free too) Everyday after our long day of walking/touring in the beautiful city, it just feels like going back to a home of our own in Venice. This hotel just makes our first Venice trip perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Charles46
Reviews.Content: Only 4 rooms; very close to Saint Mark's. We stayed just two nights here. The rooms are very trendy, spacious and comfortable. Three cutting edge TV sets, IPOD player and other gadgets. The bathroom was not very big. The IQ is more an appart-hotel than a true standard hotel, in fact, the reception is opened between 8.00 AM and 8.00 PM, at other hours services are provided by the related hotels (which are located 30 minutes away). Anyhow, we felt as having our own trendy appartment in Venice. A special remark for Michelle (at the reception) always eager and ready to assisting us, If we return to Venice, we would stay at the IQ again.
